
# Understanding the Dataset 

# 

-   It consists of 18 variables that elaborate on the nutritional compostion of different fast food items.
-   Data has been collected from 8 different fast-food outlets.
-   Overall, the dataset gives a precise and clear outlook of how healthy or how harmful a certain food item can be for consumption.
-   Few of the main variables made use of in this project from the dataset are- 'total_fat', 'calories', 'cholestrol', 'protein.

# Conclusion

-   On an average visit from the list of 8 outlets- Sonic, Arbys and Burger King have proved to have the most calories in that respective order.  
-   Chick Fil-a and Subway have shown to have the largest protein-fat ratios.
-   Taco Bell, Sonic, Dairy Queen and Burger King have insignifact differences in their protein-fat ratios.

## Code

```{python}
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
import statsmodels.api as sm
import pandas as pd

# Fit a linear regression model
X = mtcars[['speed']]
y = mtcars['mpg']
model = LinearRegression().fit(X, y)

# Summary of the model
X2 = sm.add_constant(X)
est = sm.OLS(y, X2)
est2 = est.fit()
print(est2.summary())
```
